ratings.comment: I loved this professor! He tells you what people will be on the exams and what material to study so there aren't surprises. Every once in a while he'll throw in extra credit. There is only one notetaker per lecture so you have to trust your classmates. He answers all questions as best he can and is extremely helpful.

I dreaded this class.  The subject is really boring.  It's all about philosophy.  He is very confusing in lecture.  There is only one note-taker for each class, so you have to rely on other people's notes, which is bad.  If you aren't interested in philosophy and are easily unorganized, don't take this class.

He is  great professeur for a first semester freshman. This class is really a way to teach you how to be a successful college student. He is extremely passionate even though sometimes the topics are somewhat boring. Do the reading before class, participate in class, and you are set for the exams. He is avaliable to meet with and wants you to do wel

Absolutely wonderful professor. He's extremely passionate about his subject but will listen to your questions and answers them with everything he knows and he takes one-on-one time with just you. Always available to help no matter what. He is a little eccentric, but so are all psych teachers. Best teacher I've ever had!
he is a great guy and very interesting, but i found myself bored by the material. not the class i thoght it was goign to be

Took his class my very first semester in college.  It was not easy, but not riduculously hard.  Lots of textbook reading.  Enjoyed his lectures.  Very interesting and informative.  Had a bit of a sense of humor, too.  Very helpful during office hours.
I agree, he is one of the smartest people I have ever met in my life.  I highly recommend him as a teacher.
He is nice and let us have class outside.
probably the smartest man i have ever met

He's really interested in the material he's teaching, and helps make it interesting for the class.  He's a really funny guy, and adds a personal element to the history of psych/philosophy - he can also go of on huge tangents, which also makes the class interesting. Very straighforward about what you do and don't need to know for exams
Most useful class ever, I credit this course alone, as taught by him, for my 96th% percentile score on the GRE Psychology subject test

I dreaded this class... extremely boring.  The professor is okay; he likes what he does and tries his hardest to make the class bearable.  But if your not interested in psychology and definitely not interested in the history of psychology... then DON'T take this class.
I loved him.. the class isn't the easiest class I have had, but he is so entertaining and funny that it was worth going to. He is very interested in what he does.
